Not everybody's name is Chris and not everybody has a show. But even less people named Chris have a show. My name is Chris, and this is my show.

people.name: Eric Seitz
people.about: Just a regular Catholic priest with a YouTube Channel

youtube_channels.description: Just a regular Catholic priest with a YouTube Channel

I decided to practice making Jesus my king on October 12, 2023. My videos will attempt to point people towards a relationship with God through Jesus who will go after the lost sheep. My king goes after your worst enemy to give them the best gift which is to know God.
Seeking the ideal.
Fun with friends and family.
Even Broken Clocks are right twice a day.

people.name: Jacob Faturechi
people.about: I mostly make videos about the Hebrew Bible.

youtube_channels.description: I mostly make videos about the Hebrew Bible.

Conversations. Testimonies. Journeys. Stories. Philosophy. Psychology. Religion. God knows what else.
 This has become a space to offer people a wide spectrum of beliefs, interests, opinions and stories. The conversations often center around biblical themes and narratives, but the goal is to present an open space for dialogue and understanding, and may in some instances be explicit.
A place for live streams.
Videos are submitted via email.

people.name: John Vervaeke
people.about:
John Vervaeke, PhD is a philosopher and cognitive scientist. He is an associate professor and award-winning lecturer at the University of Toronto, teaching in the Department of Psychology. His work and research is far-ranging, including topics such as human intelligence, rationality, wisdom, and AI.
 Dr. Vervaeke has been a leading intellectual observer of the modern meaning crisis: the loss of a spiritual worldview in the West, and the decline of wisdom traditions that help individuals find meaning in their lives. His online lectures and practices integrate teachings from many different disciplines, including philosophy, psychology, religion, and cutting edge cognitive science.
 Join our Patreon to support John's work, join in Live Q&A sessions, get early access to videos and more!

people.about:
Mapping the universe through physics, art, economics, philosophy, and more.

people.name: Lucas Vos
people.about: Welcome. My name is Lucas. For the longest time I had been wondering what I wanted to do with this channel, and I had a lot of trouble specifying my content. Today this hasn't changed much, but, I have found that podcasts are my strongest suit. I love speaking to people, connecting to them and learning from their perspectives. Subscribing to this channel will give you weekly conversations with people and topics worth listening to (I think). I also upload a bunch of short videos daily that may or may not be to please the algorithm and grow my channel. So likely you came through the shorts, but I sincerely hope you stay for the conversations.

youtube_channels.description: A video diary of intellectual musings. Mainly about God, faith, community, ontology. I ruminate & contemplate on things  in a circumambulating way. “When I talk about anything, I’m talking about everything.”

Here I shall be discussing how to orient and navigate the patterns in the world.  This will include our usage of words, models for understand the world, and the best way to structure our ideas. Topics will include meaning, the Intimacy crisis, sense making in the world, models that helps us map reality.  How we use our language matters to how we interact in the world. The nature of meaning, definition, context all determine how well we can discern, judge and act!
 I'll be exploring lots of topics in videos alone, with others and livestreams!
 Come and join our community of sense making in this chaotic world!
Just me talking about various things which are on my mind at one point or another. Stories, observations, nothing fancy.
This channel is an act of faith and obedience.
Nate, Michael and Shari discuss enchantment and mystical Christianity together and with guests.
I want to major in equipping those who follow me with the things that "against such things there is no law".
Video from Living Stones CRC

Visual Philosophy
 Literary Devices
 Contextual Reality
 Break the Fourth Wall

A podcast channel exploring the wonder of theology lost to modern culture. Joe Rogan, Jordan Peterson, Russell Brand, and others often touch the surface of how theology and spirituality impact society. On this podcast we take those conversations to deeper, and more meaningful places. Thanks for being here as we highlight the Biblical Christian worldview as it shows up in unexpected places.
